deprecated_object_id.title: Deprecated option object_id used
deprecated_object_id.description: Entity {entity_id} uses the `object_id` option which is deprecated. To fix the issue, replace the `object_id: {object_id}` option with `default_entity_id: {domain}.{object_id}` in your "configuration.yaml", and restart Home Assistant.

deprecated_vacuum_battery_feature.title: Deprecated battery feature used
deprecated_vacuum_battery_feature.description: Vacuum entity {entity_id} implements the battery feature which is deprecated. This will stop working in Home Assistant 2026.2. Implement a separate entity for the battery state instead. To fix the issue, remove the `battery` feature from the configured supported features, and restart Home Assistant.

invalid_platform_config.title: Invalid config found for MQTT {domain} item
invalid_platform_config.description:
Home Assistant detected an invalid config for a manually configured item.

Platform domain: **{domain}**
Configuration file: **{config_file}**
Near line: **{line}**
Configuration found:
```yaml
{config}
```
Error: **{error}**.

Make sure the configuration is valid and [reload](/developer-tools/yaml) the manually configured MQTT items or restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.

subentry_migration_discovery.title: MQTT device "{name}" subentry migration to MQTT discovery

confirm.title: [%key:component::mqtt::issues::subentry_migration_discovery::title%]
confirm.description: Exported MQTT device "{name}" identified via MQTT discovery. Select **Submit** to confirm that the MQTT device is to be migrated to the main MQTT configuration, and to remove the existing MQTT device subentry. Make sure that the discovery is retained at the MQTT broker, or is resent after the subentry is removed, so that the MQTT device will be set up correctly. As an alternative you can change the device identifiers and entity unique ID-s in your MQTT discovery configuration payload, and cancel this repair if you want to keep the MQTT device subentry.

subentry_migration_yaml.title: MQTT device "{name}" subentry migration to YAML

confirm.title: [%key:component::mqtt::issues::subentry_migration_yaml::title%]
confirm.description: Exported MQTT device "{name}" identified in YAML configuration. Select **Submit** to confirm that the MQTT device is to be migrated to main MQTT config entry, and to remove the existing MQTT device subentry. As an alternative you can change the device identifiers and entity unique ID-s in your configuration.yaml file, and cancel this repair if you want to keep the MQTT device subentry.

user.description: Please choose how you want to connect to the MQTT broker:

menu_options.broker: Manually enter the MQTT broker connection details

broker.description: Please enter the connection information of your MQTT broker.

data.client_id: Client ID (leave empty to randomly generated one)
data.keepalive: The time between sending keep alive messages

data_description.broker: The hostname or IP address of your MQTT broker.
data_description.port: The port your MQTT broker listens to. For example 1883.
data_description.username: The username to log in to your MQTT broker.
data_description.password: The password to log in to your MQTT broker.
data_description.advanced_options: Enable and select **Next** to set advanced options.
data_description.certificate: The custom CA certificate file to validate your MQTT brokers certificate.
data_description.client_id: The unique ID to identify the Home Assistant MQTT API as MQTT client. It is recommended to leave this option blank.
data_description.client_cert: The client certificate to authenticate against your MQTT broker.
data_description.client_key: The private key file that belongs to your client certificate.
data_description.client_key_password: The password for the private key file (if set).
data_description.keepalive: A value less than 90 seconds is advised.
data_description.tls_insecure: Option to ignore validation of your MQTT broker's certificate.
data_description.protocol: The MQTT protocol your broker operates at. For example 3.1.1.
data_description.set_ca_cert: Select **Auto** for automatic CA validation, or **Custom** and select **Next** to set a custom CA certificate, to allow validating your MQTT brokers certificate.
data_description.set_client_cert: Enable and select **Next** to set a client certificate and private key to authenticate against your MQTT broker.
data_description.transport: The transport to be used for the connection to your MQTT broker.
data_description.ws_headers: The WebSocket headers to pass through the WebSocket-based connection to your MQTT broker.
data_description.ws_path: The WebSocket path to be used for the connection to your MQTT broker.

hassio_confirm.title: MQTT broker via Home Assistant add-on
hassio_confirm.description: Do you want to configure Home Assistant to connect to the MQTT broker provided by the add-on {addon}?

reauth_confirm.title: Re-authentication required with the MQTT broker
reauth_confirm.description: The MQTT broker reported an authentication error. Please confirm the brokers correct username and password.

abort.addon_info_failed: Failed get info for the {addon} add-on.
abort.addon_connection_failed: Failed to connect to the {addon} add-on. Check the add-on status and try again later.

error.bad_client_cert: Invalid client certificate, ensure a valid file is supplied
error.client_key_error: Invalid private key file or invalid password supplied
error.bad_client_cert_key: Client certificate and private key are not a valid pair
error.bad_ws_headers: Supply valid HTTP headers as a JSON object
error.invalid_inclusion: The client certificate and private key must be configured together

availability.title: Availability options
availability.description: The availability feature allows a device to report its availability.

data_description.availability_topic: Topic to receive the availability payload on
data_description.availability_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-templates-with-the-mqtt-integration) to render the availability payload received on the availability topic
data_description.payload_available: The payload that indicates the device is available (defaults to 'online')
data_description.payload_not_available: The payload that indicates the device is not available (defaults to 'offline')

data_description.name: The name of the manually added MQTT device.
data_description.configuration_url: A link to the webpage that can manage the configuration of this device. Can be either a 'http://', 'https://' or an internal 'homeassistant://' URL.

data_description.sw_version: The software version of the device. E.g. '2025.1.0'.
data_description.hw_version: The hardware version of the device. E.g. 'v1.0 rev a'.

data_description.qos: The Quality of Service value the device's entities should use.

summary_menu.title: Reconfigure "{mqtt_device}"

data_description.platform: The type of the entity to configure.
data_description.name: The name of the entity. Leave empty to set it to `None` to [mark it as main feature of the MQTT device](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/mqtt/#naming-of-mqtt-entities).
data_description.entity_picture: An URL to a picture to be assigned.

delete_entity.title: Delete entity
delete_entity.description: Delete an entity. The entity will be removed from the device. Removing an entity will break any automations or scripts that depend on it.

data_description.component: Select the entity you want to delete. Minimal one entity is required.

update_entity.title: Select entity
update_entity.description: Select the entity you want to update

data_description.component: Select the entity you want to update.

entity_platform_config.title: Configure MQTT device "{mqtt_device}"
entity_platform_config.description: Please configure specific details for {platform} entity "{entity}":

data_description.alarm_control_panel_code_mode: Configures how the alarm control panel validates the code. A local code is configured with the entity and is validated by Home Assistant. A remote code is sent to the device and validated remotely. [Learn more.]({url}#code)
data_description.climate_feature_action: The climate supports reporting the current action.
data_description.climate_feature_current_humidity: The climate supports reporting the current humidity.
data_description.climate_feature_current_temperature: The climate supports reporting the current temperature.
data_description.climate_feature_power: The climate supports the power "on" and "off" commands.
data_description.climate_feature_swing_horizontal_modes: The climate supports horizontal swing modes.
data_description.climate_feature_target_temperature: The climate supports setting the target temperature.
data_description.climate_feature_target_humidity: The climate supports setting the target humidity.
data_description.device_class: The device class of the {platform} entity. [Learn more.]({url}#device_class)
data_description.entity_category: Allows marking an entity as device configuration or diagnostics. An entity with a category will not be exposed to cloud, Alexa, or Google Assistant components, nor included in indirect action calls to devices or areas. Sensor entities cannot be assigned a device configuration class. [Learn more.](https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/#registry-properties)
data_description.image_processing_mode: Select how the image data is received.
data_description.options: Options for allowed sensor state values. The sensor’s Device class must be set to Enumeration. The 'Options' setting cannot be used together with State class or Unit of measurement.
data_description.suggested_display_precision: The number of decimals which should be used in the {platform} entity state after rounding. [Learn more.]({url}#suggested_display_precision)
data_description.supported_features: The features that the entity supports.
data_description.temperature_unit: This determines the native unit of measurement the MQTT climate device works with.
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Defines the unit of measurement, if any.

data_description.suggested_display_precision: The number of decimals which should be used in the {platform} entity state after rounding. [Learn more.]({url}#suggested_display_precision)

mqtt_platform_config.title: Configure MQTT device "{mqtt_device}"
mqtt_platform_config.description: Please configure MQTT specific details for {platform} entity "{entity}":

data_description.available_tones: The siren supports tones. The `tone` variable will become available for use in the "Command template" setting. [Learn more.]({url}#available_tones)
data_description.blue_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract blue color from the state payload value. Expected result of the template is an integer from 0-255 range.
data_description.brightness_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract brightness from the state payload value. Expected result of the template is an integer from 0-255 range.
data_description.code: Specifies a code to enable or disable the alarm in the frontend. Note that this blocks sending MQTT message commands to the remote device if the code validation fails. [Learn more.]({url}#code)
data_description.code_format: A regular expression to validate a supplied code when it is set during the action to open, lock or unlock the MQTT lock. [Learn more.]({url}#code_format)
data_description.code_arm_required: If set, the code is required to arm the alarm. If not set, the code is not validated.
data_description.code_disarm_required: If set, the code is required to disarm the alarm. If not set, the code is not validated.
data_description.code_trigger_required: If set, the code is required to manually trigger the alarm. If not set, the code is not validated.
data_description.color_temp_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract color temperature in Kelvin from the state payload value. Expected result of the template is an integer.
data_description.command_off_template: The [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) for "off" state changes. Available variables are: `state` and `transition`.
data_description.command_on_template: The [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) for "on" state changes. Available variables: `state`, `brightness`, `color_temp`, `red`, `green`, `blue`, `hue`, `sat`, `flash`, `transition` and `effect`. Values `red`, `green`, `blue` and `brightness` are provided as integers from range 0-255. Value of `hue` is provided as float from range 0-360. Value of `sat` is provided as float from range 0-100. Value of `color_temp` is provided as integer representing Kelvin units.
data_description.command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to render the payload to be published at the command topic. [Learn more.]({url}#command_template)
data_description.command_topic: The publishing topic that will be used to control the {platform} entity. [Learn more.]({url}#command_topic)
data_description.content_type: The content type or the image data that is received at the image topic.
data_description.force_update: Sends update events even if the value hasn’t changed. Useful if you want to have meaningful value graphs in history. [Learn more.]({url}#force_update)
data_description.green_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract green color from the state payload value. Expected result of the template is an integer from 0-255 range.
data_description.image_encoding: Select the encoding of the received image data
data_description.image_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive messages containing the image data. [Learn more.]({url}#image_topic)
data_description.last_reset_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the last reset. When Last reset template is set, the State class option must be Total. [Learn more.]({url}#last_reset_value_template)
data_description.mode: Control how the number should be displayed in the UI. [Learn more.]({url}#mode)
data_description.modes: A list of supported operation modes. [Learn more.]({url}#modes)
data_description.mode_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate operation mode. [Learn more.]({url}#mode_command_topic)
data_description.mode_command_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to define the operation mode to be sent to the operation mode command topic. [Learn more.]({url}#mode_command_template)
data_description.mode_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive operation mode state messages. [Learn more.]({url}#mode_state_topic)
data_description.mode_state_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the operation mode state. [Learn more.]({url}#mode_state_template)
data_description.on_command_type: Defines when the payload "on" is sent. Using "Last" (the default) will send any style (brightness, color, etc) topics first and then a payload "on" to the command topic. Using "First" will send the payload "on" and then any style topics. Using "Brightness" will only send brightness commands instead of the payload "on" to turn the light on.
data_description.optimistic: Flag that defines if the {platform} entity works in optimistic mode. [Learn more.]({url}#optimistic)
data_description.options: List of options that can be selected.
data_description.payload_off: The payload that represents the "off" state.
data_description.payload_on: The payload that represents the "on" state.
data_description.payload_press: The payload to send when the button is triggered.
data_description.payload_reset: The payload received at the state topic that resets the entity to an unknown state.
data_description.qos: The QoS value a {platform} entity should use.
data_description.red_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract red color from the state payload value. Expected result of the template is an integer from 0-255 range.
data_description.retain: Select if values published by the {platform} entity should be retained at the MQTT broker.
data_description.state_off: The incoming payload that represents the "off" state. Use only when the value that represents "off" state in the state topic is different from value that should be sent to the command topic to turn the device off.
data_description.state_on: The incoming payload that represents the "on" state. Use only when the value that represents "on" state in the state topic is different from value that should be sent to the command topic to turn the device on.
data_description.state_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract state from the state payload value.
data_description.state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive {platform} state values. [Learn more.]({url}#state_topic)
data_description.support_duration: The siren supports setting a duration in second. The `duration` variable will become available for use in the "Command template" setting. [Learn more.]({url}#support_duration)
data_description.support_volume_set: The siren supports setting a volume. The `tone` variable will become available for use in the "Command template" setting. [Learn more.]({url}#support_volume_set)
data_description.supported_color_modes: A list of color modes supported by the light. Possible color modes are On/Off, Brightness, Color temperature, HS, XY, RGB, RGBW, RGBWW, White. Note that if On/Off or Brightness are used, that must be the only value in the list. [Learn more.]({url}#supported_color_modes)
data_description.url_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract an URL from the received URL topic payload value. [Learn more.]({url}#url_template)
data_description.url_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive messages containing the image URL. [Learn more.]({url}#url_topic)
data_description.value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the {platform} entity value. [Learn more.]({url}#value_template)

data_description.expire_after: If set, it defines the number of seconds after the sensor’s state expires, if it’s not updated. After expiry, the sensor’s state becomes unavailable. If not set, the sensor's state never expires. [Learn more.]({url}#expire_after)
data_description.flash: Enable the flash feature for this light
data_description.flash_time_long: The duration, in seconds, of a "long" flash.
data_description.flash_time_short: The duration, in seconds, of a "short" flash.
data_description.max_kelvin: The maximum color temperature in Kelvin.
data_description.min_kelvin: The minimum color temperature in Kelvin.
data_description.off_delay: For sensors that only send "on" state updates (like PIRs), this variable sets a delay in seconds after which the sensor’s state will be updated back to "off".
data_description.transition: Enable the transition feature for this light

data_description.payload_arm_away: The payload sent when an "arm away" command is issued.
data_description.payload_arm_custom_bypass: The payload sent when an "arm custom bypass" command is issued.
data_description.payload_arm_disarm: The payload sent when a "disarm" command is issued.
data_description.payload_arm_home: The payload sent when an "arm home" command is issued.
data_description.payload_arm_night: The payload sent when an "arm night" command is issued.
data_description.payload_arm_vacation: The payload sent when an "arm vacation" command is issued.
data_description.payload_trigger: The payload sent when a "trigger alarm" command is issued.

data_description.action_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to render the value received on the action topic with.
data_description.action_topic: The MQTT topic to subscribe for changes of the current action. If this is set, the climate graph uses the value received as data source. A "None" payload resets the current action state. An empty payload is ignored. Valid action values are: "off", "heating", "cooling", "drying", "idle" and "fan".  [Learn more.]({url}#action_topic)

data_description.fan_modes: List of fan modes this climate is capable of running at. Common fan modes that offer translations are `off`, `on`, `auto`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, `middle`, `focus` and `diffuse`.
data_description.fan_mode_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate fan mode. [Learn more.]({url}#fan_mode_command_topic)
data_description.fan_mode_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the fan mode command topic.
data_description.fan_mode_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive the climate fan mode. [Learn more.]({url}#fan_mode_state_topic)
data_description.fan_mode_state_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the climate fan mode value.

data_description.power_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the power command topic. The `value` parameter is the payload set for payload "on" or payload "off".
data_description.power_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate power state. Sends the payload configured with payload "on" or payload "off". [Learn more.]({url}#power_command_topic)

data_description.preset_mode_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate preset mode. [Learn more.]({url}#preset_mode_command_topic)
data_description.preset_modes: List of preset modes this climate is capable of running at. Common preset modes that offer translations are `none`, `away`, `eco`, `boost`, `comfort`, `home`, `sleep` and `activity`.

data_description.swing_horizontal_modes: List of horizontal swing modes this climate is capable of running at. Common horizontal swing modes that offer translations are `off` and `on`.
data_description.swing_horizontal_mode_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate horizontal swing mode. [Learn more.]({url}#swing_horizontal_mode_command_topic)
data_description.swing_horizontal_mode_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the horizontal swing mode command topic.
data_description.swing_horizontal_mode_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive the climate horizontal swing mode. [Learn more.]({url}#swing_horizontal_mode_state_topic)
data_description.swing_horizontal_mode_state_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the climate horizontal swing mode value.

data_description.swing_modes: List of swing modes this climate is capable of running at. Common swing modes that offer translations are `off`, `on`, `vertical`, `horizontal` and `both`.
data_description.swing_mode_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate swing mode. [Learn more.]({url}#swing_mode_command_topic)
data_description.swing_mode_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the swing mode command topic.
data_description.swing_mode_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive the climate swing mode. [Learn more.]({url}#swing_mode_state_topic)
data_description.swing_mode_state_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the climate swing mode value.

data_description.payload_close: The payload sent when a "close" command is issued.
data_description.payload_open: The payload sent when an "open" command is issued.
data_description.payload_stop: The payload sent when a "stop" command is issued. Leave empty to disable the "stop" feature.
data_description.payload_stop_tilt: The payload sent when a "stop tilt" command is issued.
data_description.state_closed: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "closed" state.
data_description.state_closing: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "closing" state.
data_description.state_open: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "open" state.
data_description.state_opening: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "opening" state.
data_description.state_stopped: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "stopped" state (for covers that do not report "open"/"closed" state).

data_description.position_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the payload for the position topic. Within the template the following variables are also available: `entity_id`, `position_open`, `position_closed`, `tilt_min` and `tilt_max`. [Learn more.]({url}#position_template)
data_description.position_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive cover position state messages. [Learn more.]({url}#position_topic)
data_description.set_position_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to define the position to be sent to the set position topic. Within the template the following variables are available: `value` (the scaled target position), `entity_id`, `position` (the target position percentage), `position_open`, `position_closed`, `tilt_min` and `tilt_max`. [Learn more.]({url}#set_position_template)
data_description.set_position_topic: The MQTT topic to publish position commands to. You need to use the set position topic as well if you want to use the position topic. Use template if position topic wants different values than within range "position closed" - "position_open". If template is not defined and position "closed" != 100 and position "open" != 0 then proper position value is calculated from percentage position. [Learn more.]({url}#set_position_topic)

data_description.tilt_closed_value: The value that will be sent to the "tilt command topic" when the cover tilt is closed.
data_description.tilt_command_template: [Template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to define the position to be sent to the tilt command topic. Within the template the following variables are available: `entity_id`, `tilt_position` (the target tilt position percentage), `position_open`, `position_closed`, `tilt_min` and `tilt_max`. [Learn more.]({url}#tilt_command_template)
data_description.tilt_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to control the cover tilt. [Learn more.]({url}#tilt_command_topic)
data_description.tilt_opened_value: The value that will be sent to the "tilt command topic" when the cover tilt is opened.
data_description.tilt_status_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the payload for the tilt status topic. Within the template the following variables are available: `entity_id`, `position_open`, `position_closed`, `tilt_min` and `tilt_max`. [Learn more.]({url}#tilt_status_template)
data_description.tilt_status_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive tilt status update values. [Learn more.]({url}#tilt_status_topic)
data_description.tilt_optimistic: Flag that defines if tilt works in optimistic mode. If tilt status topic is not defined, tilt works in optimistic mode by default. [Learn more.]({url}#tilt_optimistic)

data_description.current_humidity_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the current humidity value. [Learn more.]({url}#current_humidity_template)
data_description.current_humidity_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive current humidity update values. [Learn more.]({url}#current_humidity_topic)

data_description.current_temperature_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the current temperature value. [Learn more.]({url}#current_temperature_template)
data_description.current_temperature_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive current temperature update values. [Learn more.]({url}#current_temperature_topic)

data_description.brightness: Flag that defines if light supports brightness when the RGB, RGBW, or RGBWW color mode is supported.
data_description.brightness_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the brightness command topic.
data_description.brightness_command_topic: The publishing topic that will be used to control the brightness. [Learn more.]({url}#brightness_command_topic)
data_description.brightness_scale: Defines the maximum brightness value (i.e., 100%) of the maximum brightness.
data_description.brightness_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive brightness state values. [Learn more.]({url}#brightness_state_topic)
data_description.brightness_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the brightness value.

data_description.payload_lock: The payload sent when a "lock" command is issued.
data_description.payload_open: The payload sent when an "open" command is issued. Set this payload if your lock supports the "open" action.
data_description.payload_reset: The payload received at the state topic that resets the lock to an unknown state.
data_description.payload_unlock: The payload sent when an "unlock" command is issued.
data_description.state_jammed: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "jammed" state.
data_description.state_locked: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "locked" state.
data_description.state_locking: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "locking" state.
data_description.state_unlocked: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "unlocked" state.
data_description.state_unlocking: The payload received at the state topic that represents the "unlocking" state.

data_description.direction_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the fan direction. The payload will be either `forward` or `reverse` and can be customized using the direction command template. [Learn more.]({url}#direction_command_topic)
data_description.direction_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the direction command topic. The template variable `value` will be either `forward` or `reverse`.
data_description.direction_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive fan direction state. Accepted state payloads are `forward` or `reverse`. [Learn more.]({url}#direction_state_topic)
data_description.direction_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract fan direction state value. The template should return either `forward` or `reverse`. When the template returns an empty string, the direction will be ignored.

data_description.oscillation_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the fan oscillation state. [Learn more.]({url}#oscillation_command_topic)
data_description.oscillation_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the oscillation command topic.
data_description.oscillation_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive fan oscillation state. [Learn more.]({url}#oscillation_state_topic)
data_description.oscillation_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract fan oscillation state value.
data_description.payload_oscillation_off: The payload that represents the oscillation "off" state.
data_description.payload_oscillation_on: The payload that represents the oscillation "on" state.

data_description.payload_reset_preset_mode: A special payload that resets the fan preset mode state attribute to unknown when received at the preset mode state topic.
data_description.preset_modes: List of preset modes this fan is capable of running at. Common examples include auto, smart, whoosh, eco and breeze.
data_description.preset_mode_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the fan preset mode. [Learn more.]({url}#preset_mode_command_topic)
data_description.preset_mode_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the preset mode command topic.
data_description.preset_mode_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive fan preset mode. [Learn more.]({url}#preset_mode_state_topic)
data_description.preset_mode_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract fan preset mode value.

data_description.payload_reset_percentage: A special payload that resets the fan speed percentage state attribute to unknown when received at the percentage state topic.
data_description.percentage_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the fan speed state based on a percentage. [Learn more.]({url}#percentage_command_topic)
data_description.percentage_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the percentage command topic.
data_description.percentage_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive fan speed based on percentage. [Learn more.]({url}#percentage_state_topic)
data_description.percentage_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the speed percentage value.
data_description.speed_range_min: The minimum of numeric output range (off not included, so speed_range_min - 1 represents 0 %). The percentage step is 100 / the number of speeds within the "speed range".
data_description.speed_range_max: The maximum of numeric output range (representing 100 %). The percentage step is 100 / number of speeds within the "speed range".

data_description.color_mode_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive color mode updates. If this is not configured, the color mode will be automatically set according to the last received valid color or color temperature.
data_description.color_mode_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the color mode value.

data_description.color_temp_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the color temperature command topic.
data_description.color_temp_command_topic: The publishing topic that will be used to control the color temperature. [Learn more.]({url}#color_temp_command_topic)
data_description.color_temp_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive color temperature state updates. [Learn more.]({url}#color_temp_state_topic)
data_description.color_temp_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the color temperature value.

data_description.effect: Flag that defines if the light supports effects.
data_description.effect_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the effect command topic.
data_description.effect_command_topic: The publishing topic that will be used to control the light's effect state. [Learn more.]({url}#effect_command_topic)
data_description.effect_list: The list of effects the light supports.
data_description.effect_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive effect state updates. [Learn more.]({url}#effect_state_topic)

data_description.hs_command_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose message which will be sent to HS command topic. Available variables: `hue` and `sat`.
data_description.hs_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the light’s color state in HS format (Hue Saturation). Range for Hue: 0° .. 360°, Range of Saturation: 0..100. Note: Brightness is sent separately in the brightness command topic. [Learn more.]({url}#hs_command_topic)
data_description.hs_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive color state updates in HS format. The expected payload is the hue and saturation values separated by commas, for example, `359.5,100.0`. Note: Brightness is received separately in the brightness state topic. [Learn more.]({url}#hs_state_topic)
data_description.hs_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the HS value.

data_description.rgb_command_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose message which will be sent to RGB command topic. Available variables: `red`, `green` and `blue`.
data_description.rgb_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the light’s RGB state. [Learn more.]({url}#rgb_command_topic)
data_description.rgb_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive RGB state updates. The expected payload is the RGB values separated by commas, for example, `255,0,127`. [Learn more.]({url}#rgb_state_topic)
data_description.rgb_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the RGB value.

data_description.rgbw_command_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose message which will be sent to RGBW command topic. Available variables: `red`, `green`, `blue` and `white`.
data_description.rgbw_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the light’s RGBW state. [Learn more.]({url}#rgbw_command_topic)
data_description.rgbw_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive RGBW state updates. The expected payload is the RGBW values separated by commas, for example, `255,0,127,64`. [Learn more.]({url}#rgbw_state_topic)
data_description.rgbw_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the RGBW value.

data_description.rgbww_command_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose message which will be sent to RGBWW command topic. Available variables: `red`, `green`, `blue`, `cold_white` and `warm_white`.
data_description.rgbww_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the light’s RGBWW state. [Learn more.]({url}#rgbww_command_topic)
data_description.rgbww_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive RGBWW state updates. The expected payload is the RGBWW values separated by commas, for example, `255,0,127,64,32`. [Learn more.]({url}#rgbww_state_topic)
data_description.rgbww_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the RGBWW value.

data_description.white_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the light to white mode with a given brightness. [Learn more.]({url}#white_command_topic)
data_description.white_scale: Defines the maximum white level (i.e., 100%) of the maximum.

data_description.xy_command_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose message which will be sent to XY command topic. Available variables: `x` and `y`.
data_description.xy_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the light’s XY state. [Learn more.]({url}#xy_command_topic)
data_description.xy_state_topic: The MQTT topic subscribed to receive XY state updates. The expected payload is the X and Y color values separated by commas, for example, `0.675,0.322`. [Learn more.]({url}#xy_state_topic)
data_description.xy_value_template: Defines a [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to extract the XY value.

data_description.max_humidity: The maximum target humidity that can be set.
data_description.min_humidity: The minimum target humidity that can be set.
data_description.target_humidity_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the target humidity command topic.
data_description.target_humidity_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate target humidity. [Learn more.]({url}#humidity_command_topic)
data_description.target_humidity_state_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to render the value received on the target humidity state topic with.
data_description.target_humidity_state_topic: The MQTT topic to subscribe for changes of the target humidity. [Learn more.]({url}#humidity_state_topic)

data_description.command_off_template: The [template]({templating_url}#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) for "off" state changes. By default the "[Command template]({url}#command_template)" will be used.  [Learn more.]({url}#command_off_template)

data_description.initial: The climate initializes with this target temperature.
data_description.max_temp: The maximum target temperature that can be set.
data_description.min_temp: The minimum target temperature that can be set.
data_description.precision: The precision in degrees the thermostat is working at.
data_description.temp_step: The target temperature step in degrees Celsius or Fahrenheit.
data_description.temperature_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the temperature command topic.
data_description.temperature_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate target temperature. [Learn more.]({url}#temperature_command_topic)
data_description.temperature_high_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the upper temperature command topic.
data_description.temperature_high_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate upper target temperature. [Learn more.]({url}#temperature_high_command_topic)
data_description.temperature_low_command_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-command-templates-with-mqtt) to compose the payload to be published at the lower temperature command topic.
data_description.temperature_low_command_topic: The MQTT topic to publish commands to change the climate lower target temperature. [Learn more.]({url}#temperature_low_command_topic)
data_description.temperature_state_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to render the value received on the temperature state topic with.
data_description.temperature_state_topic: The MQTT topic to subscribe for changes of the target temperature. [Learn more.]({url}#temperature_state_topic)
data_description.temperature_high_state_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to render the value received on the upper temperature state topic with.
data_description.temperature_high_state_topic: The MQTT topic to subscribe for changes of the upper target temperature. [Learn more.]({url}#temperature_high_state_topic)
data_description.temperature_low_state_template: A [template](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/templating/#using-value-templates-with-mqtt) to render the value received on the lower temperature state topic with.
data_description.temperature_low_state_topic: The MQTT topic to subscribe for changes of the lower target temperature. [Learn more.]({url}#temperature_low_state_topic)

export.title: Export MQTT device config
export.description: An export allows you to migrate the MQTT device configuration to YAML-based configuration or MQTT discovery. The configuration export can also be helpful for troubleshooting.

export_yaml.title: [%key:component::mqtt::config_subentries::device::step::export::title%]
export_yaml.description: You can copy the configuration below and place it your configuration.yaml file. Home Assistant will detect if the setup of the MQTT device was tried via YAML instead, and will offer a repair flow to clean up the redundant subentry. You can also choose to change the identifiers if you do not want to remove the subentry.

export_discovery.title: [%key:component::mqtt::config_subentries::device::step::export::title%]
export_discovery.description: To allow setup via MQTT [discovery]({url}#device-discovery-payload), the discovery payload needs to be published to the discovery topic. Copy the information from the fields below. Home Assistant will detect if the setup of the MQTT device was tried via MQTT discovery instead, and will offer a repair flow to clean up the redundant subentry. You can also choose to change the identifiers if you do not want to remove the subentry.

data_description.discovery_topic: The [discovery topic]({url}#discovery-topic) to publish the discovery payload, used to trigger MQTT discovery. An empty payload published to this topic will remove the device and discovered entities.
data_description.discovery_payload: The JSON [discovery payload]({url}#device-discovery-payload) that contains information about the MQTT device.

create_entry.default:
MQTT device with {platform} entity "{entity}" was set up successfully.

Note that you can reconfigure the MQTT device at any time, e.g. to add more entities.

error.cover_get_and_set_position_must_be_set_t: The get position and set position topic options must be set together
error.cover_get_position_template_must_be_used: The position value template must be used together with the position state topic
error.cover_set_position_template_must_be_used: The set position template must be used with the set position topic
error.cover_tilt_command_template_must_be_used: The tilt command template must be used with the tilt command topic
error.cover_tilt_status_template_must_be_used_: The tilt value template must be used with the tilt status topic
error.cover_value_template_must_be_used_with_s: The value template must be used with the state topic option
error.empty_list_not_allowed: Empty list is not allowed. Add at least one item
error.fan_speed_range_max_must_be_greater_than: Speed range max must be greater than speed range min
error.fan_preset_mode_reset_in_preset_modes_li: Payload "reset preset mode" is not a valid as a preset mode
error.invalid_regular_expression: Must be a valid regular expression
error.invalid_uom: The unit of measurement "{unit_of_measurement}" is not supported by the selected device class, please either remove the device class, select a device class which supports "{unit_of_measurement}", or pick a supported unit of measurement from the list
error.invalid_uom_for_state_class: The unit of measurement "{unit_of_measurement}" is not supported by the selected state class, please either remove the state class, select a state class which supports "{unit_of_measurement}", or pick a supported unit of measurement from the list
error.last_reset_not_with_state_class_total: The last reset value template option should be used with state class 'Total' only
error.max_below_min: Max value should be greater or equal to min value
error.max_below_min_humidity: Max humidity value should be greater than min humidity value
error.max_below_min_kelvin: Max Kelvin value should be greater than min Kelvin value
error.max_below_min_temperature: Max temperature value should be greater than min temperature value
error.options_not_allowed_with_state_class_or_: The 'Options' setting is not allowed when state class or unit of measurement are used
error.options_device_class_enum: The 'Options' setting must be used with the Enumeration device class. If you continue, the existing options will be reset
error.options_with_enum_device_class: Configure options for the enumeration sensor
error.preset_mode_none_not_allowed: Preset "none" is not a valid preset mode
error.uom_required_for_device_class: The selected device class requires a unit

options.title: MQTT options
options.description:
Discovery - If discovery is enabled (recommended), Home Assistant will automatically discover devices and entities which publish their configuration on the MQTT broker. If discovery is disabled, all configuration must be done manually.
Discovery prefix - The prefix a configuration topic for automatic discovery must start with.
Birth message - The birth message will be sent each time Home Assistant (re)connects to the MQTT broker.
Will message - The will message will be sent each time Home Assistant loses its connection to the broker, both in case of a clean (e.g. Home Assistant shutting down) and in case of an unclean (e.g. Home Assistant crashing or losing its network connection) disconnect.

data_description.discovery: Option to enable MQTT automatic discovery.
data_description.discovery_prefix: The prefix of configuration topics the MQTT integration will subscribe to.
data_description.birth_enable: When set, Home Assistant will publish an online message to your MQTT broker when MQTT is ready.
data_description.birth_topic: The MQTT topic where Home Assistant will publish a "birth" message.
data_description.birth_payload: The "birth" message that is published when MQTT is ready and connected.
data_description.birth_qos: The quality of service of the "birth" message that is published when MQTT is ready and connected
data_description.birth_retain: When set, Home Assistant will retain the "birth" message published to your MQTT broker.
data_description.will_enable: When set, Home Assistant will ask your broker to publish a "will" message when MQTT is stopped or when it loses the connection to your broker.
data_description.will_topic: The MQTT topic your MQTT broker will publish a "will" message to.
data_description.will_payload: The message your MQTT broker "will" publish when the MQTT integration is stopped or when the connection is lost.
data_description.will_qos: The quality of service of the "will" message that is published by your MQTT broker.
data_description.will_retain: When set, your MQTT broker will retain the "will" message.

publish.name: Publish
publish.description: Publishes a message to an MQTT topic.

evaluate_payload.name: Evaluate payload
evaluate_payload.description: If 'Payload' is a Python bytes literal, evaluate the bytes literal and publish the raw data.

payload.name: Payload
payload.description: The payload to publish. Publishes an empty message if not provided.

qos.name: QoS
qos.description: Quality of Service to use. 0: At most once. 1: At least once. 2: Exactly once.

retain.name: Retain
retain.description: If the message should have the retain flag set. If set, the broker stores the most recent message on a topic.

dump.name: Export
dump.description: Writes all messages on a specific topic into the `mqtt_dump.txt` file in your configuration folder.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: How long we should listen for messages in seconds.

reload.name: [%key:common::action::reload%]
reload.description: Reloads MQTT entities from the YAML-configuration.

_.name: MQTT
_.description: When a specific message is received on a given MQTT topic.
_.description_configured: When an MQTT message has been received

command_template_error.message: Parsing template `{command_template}` for entity `{entity_id}` failed with error: {error}.

invalid_platform_config.message: Reloading YAML config for manually configured MQTT `{domain}` item failed. See logs for more details.

invalid_publish_topic.message: Unable to publish: topic template `{topic_template}` produced an invalid topic `{topic}` after rendering ({error})

mqtt_not_setup_cannot_subscribe.message: Cannot subscribe to topic "{topic}", make sure MQTT is set up correctly.

mqtt_not_setup_cannot_publish.message: Cannot publish to topic "{topic}", make sure MQTT is set up correctly.

mqtt_topic_not_a_string.message: Topic needs to be a string! Got: {topic}.
